constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 54 (Monday, March 28, 2022)]
[House]
[Pages H3896-H3897]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mrs. RODGERS of Washington:
H.R. 7255.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Clause 1, Section 8 of Article 1 of the United States
Constitution which reads:
[[Page H3897]]
``The Congress shall have Power to lay and collect Taxes,
Duties, Imposts, and Excises, to pay the Debts, and provide
for the common Defense and General Welfare of the United
States; but all Duties and Imposts and Excises shall be
uniform throughout the United States.''

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

title: Garrett Lee Smith Memorial Reauthorization Act
